result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State. Attorney Donald J Bielski in court for Edward J. Spates Jr. Defendant Edward J. Spates Jr. appeared by video, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Bielski's bond motion. Attorney Bielski advised that he is in possession of 2 U.S. Treasury checks. He tried to cash them for the DE and was unable to do so. Court takes possession of the checks as security and Court deems the bond paid. Court to hold on to the checks for now. Checks sent to Beth in 204.
With Attorney Bielski a MH has been set to 10/27/22 at 9:30 regarding the bond motion filed.
for Reduction of Bond.
Atty Donald Bielski

Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State. Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State. Attorney Donald J Bielski in court for Edward J. Spates. Attorney Donald J Bielski appeared by video for Edward J. Spates. Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Bielski is working on getting an offer. Attorney Bielski also asks about speedy trial demand. Court advises this issue.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Jury selection scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

NO RECORD MADE. State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Attorney Donald J Bielski in court for Edward J. Spates. Defendant Edward J. Spates appeared by video, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Bielski has recently been appointed to this case and has not had time to review discovery.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody.  Clerk. M.Burke. SPD advised court that they made numerous attempts to find counsel for the DE. Court appoints advocate counsel. Attorney Bielski appointed. Court waives repayment. STC set to 09/19/22 at 2:00.
No Attorney Assigned

Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody.  Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Parise appears on 21CF378. Attorney Parise advises that the DE is eligible for a public defender. SPD is working on appointing counsel. STC set to 09/01/22 at 2:00.
No Attorney Assigned
from DE.
Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody by zoom.  Clerk. M.Burke. SPD is still working on appointing of a public defender. STC set to 08/10/22 at 2:30.
No Attorney Assigned

Defendant Edward J. Spates in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE is elibigle for SPD.  Court holds colloquy with  DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time for preliminary hearing.   DE proceeds pro se today.     ST called witness  KPD Ofc Albert Gonzales; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by DE.  DE witness sworn and testified Eileen Spates; no cross by State.   ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered.  DE makes speedy trial demand orally today.   Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.   Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Attorney Assigned
